Pertamina Raises Non-Subsidized Fuel Prices Across Indonesia
body: Pertamina raises non-subsidized fuel prices across Indonesia effective July 1, with Pertamax and diesel prices increasing.

title: President Prabowo Inaugurates Danantara Headquarters in Jakarta
body: President Prabowo inaugurates Danantara Indonesia's new headquarters in Jakarta as the agency expands efforts to drive investment and growth

title: Agriculture Minister to Expose 212 Rice Brands for Alleged Mislabeling and Price Gouging
body: Violations include mislabeling lower-quality rice as premium, selling above the government’s price ceiling, and operating without licenses.

title: JCI Tracks Wall Street Gains as Investors Await Key Economic Data
body: JCI edges up tracking Wall Street gains as investors await US jobs data, Fed signals, and China PMI for cues on rates and growth outlook.

title: Indonesia Eases Import Rules on 10 Products to Support Industries, Growth
body: The deregulation is part of a broader economic reform package designed to simplify bureaucracy, reduce costs, and stimulate growth.

title: China Lifts Nearly 2-Year Ban on Seafood from Japan over Fukushima Wastewater
body: The ban will remain in place for seafood from 10 of Japan's 47 prefectures, including Fukushima and nearby ones.

title: Over 1,500 Australian Dairy Cows Arrive in Indonesia
body: Indonesia is importing Australian dairy cows to boost its milk production.

title: Bali Governor Says Hotel Occupancy Surging, Denies Mass Layoffs in Tourism Sector
body: Last year, the island welcomed 6.4 million international tourists and 9.5 million domestic visitors.

title: West Java’s Upcoming Battery Plant to Power 300,000 EVs Annually
body: The Karawang plant will be fully integrated with five supporting facilities and upstream mining operations located in East Halmahera.

title: Indonesia Begins Construction of $5.9 Billion Mega EV Battery Hub With China’s CATL Consortium
body: The battery plant in Karawang will be integrated with five supporting facilities and upstream operations in East Halmahera, North Maluku.

title: Indonesia to Legalize Marginal Oil Wells with 20,000 bpd Potential
body: The new ministerial regulation is set to take effect on July 3, providing a legal framework for small-scale, individually operated wells.

title: Truckers Forced to Overload or Lose Orders as Indonesia Cracks Down on ODOL
body: Truckers face losing orders if they don’t overload, as Indonesia moves to enforce an ODOL ban to curb Rp 43.5T in annual road damage.

title: Jakarta, Kuala Lumpur Agree to Jointly Tap Ambalat’s Oil and Gas Reserves
body: Indonesia and Malaysia agree to jointly develop the Ambalat oil block, easing a decades-old maritime dispute while boosting energy ties

title: Medco Energi to Send 600 MW of Clean Power to Singapore
body: Medco Energi plans to export 600 MW of solar power to Singapore via Pulau Bulan.

title: Trump Says US Has Signed a Deal with China on Trade
body: China’s Commerce Ministry said Friday that the two sides had “further confirmed the details of the framework.”

title: Global Oil Shocks Bring Windfall for Indonesia’s Commodity Exports, Says Lawmaker
body: The 2025 state budget assumes an average global crude price of $82 per barrel.

title: Pertamina Shipping Arm Posts $558 Million Profit in 2024 as Fleet Expands Beyond 100 Vessels
body: The company’s fleet now serves 65 international routes, a significant jump from 11 routes in 2021, reflecting its rapid global expansion.

title: Indonesia’s Cepu Block, Operated by ExxonMobil, Powers 25% of National Oil Output
body: The investment in the Cepu Block totaled $4 billion, but it has already generated $35 billion for the state.

title: Israel-Iran War Impetus for Indonesia to Use More Palm Oil Biodiesel
body: The Iranian parliament recently backed a measure to close the Strait of Hormuz, a strategic waterway for the world's oil distribution.

title: Indonesia Needs Database That Shows How Many Houses It Really Needs
body: A database will enable Indonesia to make sure that its housing development is data-driven.

title: Indonesia Needs Database That Shows How Many Houses It Really Needs
body: A database will enable Indonesia to make sure that its housing development is data-driven.

title: Hashim Says Gov't May Scrap Controversial 18-Square-Meter Design for Subsidized Homes
body: According to existing housing regulations, the minimum legal standard for livable housing is 36 square meters.

title: Indokripto Eyes $14 Million in Indonesia’s First Crypto IPO
body: COIN, holding firm of Indonesia's regulated crypto exchange, seeks Rp 231B in IPO debut, marking the nation's first crypto listing.

title: Danantara Makes First Overseas Investment with $120M Stake in Philippine Solar Firm
body: Danantara invests $120M via Pertamina NRE to acquire 20% of Philippine solar firm CREC, marking its first overseas renewable investment.

title: Prabowo Launches Rp 25 Trillion Renewable Energy Projects in 15 Provinces
body: Prabowo launches Rp 25T renewable energy projects in 15 provinces, targeting 379.7 MW capacity.

title: Al Qilaa Launches $2.5B Housing Plan to Help Ease Indonesia’s 15M Backlog
body: Qatari firm Al Qilaa to build 50,000 affordable units in Indonesia’s $2.5B housing project, part of efforts to cut 15M-unit backlog.

title: Indonesia Says US Welcomes Its Trade Proposal as Tariff Clock Ticks
body: Indonesia and the rest of the world has two weeks until Trump's reciprocal tariffs enter into force.

title: New Tax Rule: Online Sellers Earning Over Rp 500M to Face 0.5% Income Tax
body: Finance Ministry to shift PPh 22 collection to e‑commerce marketplaces, targeting sellers with annual turnover above Rp 500M.

title: Indonesia Cancels ADB Housing Loan after Securing $8B in Domestic Financing
body: In February, ADB had offered a loan of $138 million to support Indonesia’s 3 Million Homes Program.

title: House to Appoint New Central Bank Deputy Governor Next Week
body: One of the two candidates will succeed Deputy Governor Doni Primanto Joewono, who is approaching retirement.

title: Government Weighs Full Reopening of Bandung Airport Amid Economic Debate
body: Currently, the airport serves only one carrier, Susi Air, operating two domestic routes: Bandung-Pangandaran and Bandung-Jakarta.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Surpasses 950 Listed Companies, Profit Soars
body: IDX posts Rp 673b profit in 2024, up 16% from last year, as new IPOs, debt listings, and rising retail participation fuel strong growth.

title: US Stocks Approach Their All-Time High as Oil Prices Tumble
body: The strongest action was again in the oil market, where a barrel of benchmark US crude fell 6 percent to settle at $64.37.

title: Indonesia Plans First Nuclear Power Plant by 2034, Eyes Partnerships with Russia and Canada
body: The proposed facility is designed to have a capacity of up to 500 megawatts and will be developed across Sumatra and Kalimantan.

title: Indonesia Urged to Act on $8 Billion Low-Carbon Fuel Export Opportunity
body: Eurocham expert urges early investment to capitalize on global demand and incentives.

title: Garuda Indonesia Targets 120 Aircraft by 2030 Following $407M Capital Boost
body: Garuda operated 144 aircraft prior to the COVID-19 pandemic, but that number dropped to fewer than 40 after a debt restructuring in 2022.

title: Indonesia Reassesses $24 Billion Refinery Project with Russia’s Rosneft
body: Seven years after launch, the Pertamina-Rosneft project in East Java faces an investment review over limited progress

title: Garuda Indonesia Secures $405 Million Loan from Danantara
body: Garuda Indonesia will use the shareholder loan from Danantara for maintenance and inspection work.

title: BRMS Underground Gold Mine to Triple Output by 2027
body: BRMS to open its first underground gold mine in Palu by 2027, aiming to triple output as Q1 profit surges 296% on strong gold sales.

title: Indonesia’s Palm Oil Export Drops 39 Pct as EU Buys Less
body: Indonesia only exported around 1.78 million tons of palm oil products in April, down 39.2 percent from the previous month.
